oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; School buses; Outbuildings
Education; Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of the front exterior and yard of Pleasant Plains School. The school has two entry/exit doors and is wood frame.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Pleasant Plains School was a four-room school in Humbolt, Tennessee. In the year it was photographed, there were four teachers and 159 students. The principal, Ethel Mitchum Smith, listed attendance as the school's outstanding feature. The school had an active music program in which students learned piano and xylophone.
